Data Cache Module Functions¶

Data_Cache.outgoing_push(dev, msg_p, msg, outgoing_available_queues, msg_counter, flush, incoming_available_queues)¶

Function that pushes outgoing messages into the outgoing buffer.

Parameters:
  • dev (int) – Specifies the device location in the matrix.
  • msg_p (int) – Specifies the message priority location in the matrix
  • outgoing_available_queues (list) – A list of tuples that specify the location of outgoing queues that currently have stored messages
  • msg_counter (int) – Keeps track of the number of total messags currently being stored in the buffers.
  • flush (int) – Value indicating if the data cache needs to flush the buffers into files.
  • incoming_available_queues (list) – A list of tuples that specify the location of incoming queues that currently have stored messages
Data_Cache.incoming_push(device, msg_p, msg, incoming_available_queues, msg_counter, flush, outgoing_available_queues)¶

Function that pushes incoming messages to the incoming buffer.

Parameters:
  • dev (int) – Specifies the device location in the matrix.
  • msg_p (int) – Specifies the message priority location in the matrix
  • outgoing_available_queues (list) – A list of tuples that specify the location of outgoing queues that currently have stored messages
  • msg_counter (int) – Keeps track of total messages in the data cache.
  • flush (int) – Value indicating if the data cache needs to flush the buffers into files.
  • incoming_available_queues (list) – A list of tuples that specify the location of incoming queues that currently have stored messages
Data_Cache.outgoing_pull(outgoing_available_queues, msg_counter)¶

Function that retrieves and removes outgoing messages from the outgoing buffer. Retrieves the highest priority messages first. Highest priority messages are determined based on message priority and device priority.

Parameters:
  • outgoing_available_queues (list) – The list of outgoing queues that currently have messages stored in them.
  • msg_counter (int) – Keeps track of total messages in the data cache.
Rtype string:

Returns a packed message or ‘False’ if no messages are available.
Data_Cache.incoming_pull(dev, incoming_available_queues, msg_counter)¶

Function that retrieves and removes incoming messages from the incoming buffer. Searches through all of the message priority queues for the specified device to return the highest priority message first.

Parameters:
  • dev (int) – Specifies the device location in the matrix.
  • incoming_available_queues (list) – The list of incoming queues that currently have messages stored in them.
  • msg_counter (int) – Keeps track of total messages in the data cache.
Data_Cache.DC_flush(flush, incoming_available_queues, outgoing_available_queues, msg_counter)¶

Function that flushes all stored messages from the buffers to files. Temporarily shuts down the push and pull server while the queues are being written to files.

Parameters:
  • flush (int) – Shared indicator that the data cache is being flushed.
  • incoming_available_queues (list) – The list of incoming queues that currently have messages stored in them.
  • outgoing_available_queues (list) – The list of outgoing queues that currently have messages stored in them.
  • msg_counter (int) – Keeps track of total messages in the data cache.
Data_Cache.get_status()¶

Function that returns the number of messages currently stored in the data cache.

Data_Cache.update_device_priority(updated_priority)¶

Updates the order of devices in the priority list.

Parameters:updated_priority (list) – A list containing the new priority order of the devices.
Data_Cache.update_mem(memory)¶

Updates the amount of memory allocated to the data cache.

Parameters:memory (int) – The amount of memory to be allocated to the data cache.
Data_Cache.make_bffr(length)¶

Generates a buffer, which is a matrix containing queues.

Parameters:length (int) – Specifies the number of rows in the matrix
Rtype list buff:
 The matrix containing queues
Data_Cache.get_priority(outgoing_available_queues)¶

Function that finds the highest priority queue in the list. Highest priority is determined by comparing message priority and device priority.

Parameters:outgoing_available_queues (list) – The list of outgoing queues that currently have messages stored in them.
Return type:tuple(device_priority, message_priority) or string ‘False’
